meanings.sent1: The company aimed to reach a giga number of customers by the end of the year.
meanings.sent2: The computer had a storage capacity of one giga byte.
meanings.sent3: The giga party was a huge success, with a billion balloons filling the room.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was a giga bubble, ready to burst with joy.
meanings.sent5: The giga amount of stars in the sky twinkled brightly on that clear night.

meanings.definition: A unit of information equal to one billion (10^9) bytes.
meanings.sent1: The new smartphone boasted a storage capacity of one giga byte.
meanings.sent2: She transferred a giga amount of data in just a few seconds.
meanings.sent3: The giga bytes of music on his playlist could last for days.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a giga byte of happiness, spreading warmth to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The giga bytes of photos captured every precious moment of the trip.

meanings.definition: A prefix denoting a factor of one billion (10^9) in the International System of Units (SI).
meanings.sent1: The satellite transmitted data in giga hertz frequencies.
meanings.sent2: The speed of the processor was measured in giga cycles per second.
meanings.sent3: The giga speed of the roller coaster made everyone scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: His energy level was a giga boost, propelling him through the race.
meanings.sent5: The giga power of the engine roared to life, propelling the car forward.
